data.title: FULL OF SURPRISES!
data.text: The Bloody Mary is all I need to tell you about!!! The food is legit and tasty. One of my favorites for BBQ on the coast.

data.title: The best barbecue around.
data.text: This is a very casual, yet comfortable place. The staff is very friendly and fast. I love the pulled pork here. They also have excellent brisket, and the corn bread is awesome. They have a great lineup of beers. Try the Ale Smith Nut Brown. Everyone at my table loved it.

data.title: Awesome food & service
data.text: This restaurant came highly recommended by friends so we went there to eat & weren't disappointed! Food was excellent & everyone was so friendly. Brisket mouthwatering & chicken & waffles best ever.

data.title: Can't accommodate larger parties
data.text: I called ahead because we had a group of 9, but they don't take reservations no matter how big the party. The place is small. They told me the wait would be about 30 min. When we got there, they said the wait would be 30-45 min. After 30 min, they said they would definitely have a table for us in 15 minutes, and pointed out which one; the folks sitting there were almost done. 15 minutes later, we asked again, and they said 3 people were just finishing up. Then we noticed that they were three new people at the table they said was ours. We asked and the host said they weren't new and were just finishing up. Then we saw those three people just getting their meals, so they had in fact been newly seated at the table promised to us (3 at a table for 10). By this point, we'd been waiting over an hour on the street. We walked across the street to Swami's, where we were seated immediately and enjoyed fantastic appetizers, drinks, meals and desserts, as well as excellent service.

data.title: That Good Food
data.text:
A great find on the Coast Highway. We had discovered several great places along this stretch of Oceanside. In 4 days we hit some fine eateries but this one night we needed Barbeque. My combo plate was awesome with links, Back Ribs and pulled pork. The Collared greens and Beans were fabulous. My wife had the chicken and waffle appetizer and shared my goods.

We had heard from friends that the chicken and waffles were the real attraction with people driving miles for it. (we just had to walk 6 blocks)

We sat at the bar watching a bit of baseball, listening to some fine Blues/Rock radio and just getting that good fix of Southern BBQ-West Coast Highway Style.

data.title: Don't pass this spot up
data.text:
I love sampling all the local bbq spots when I travel so I decided to come here.
I ordered a brisket sandwich with greens and an order of the catfish strips.
The sandwich was large and they hooked it up on the brisket l.. You could taste the smoke. Yum. Bun was fresh and soft.
The collard greens were good as well but the portion was a little small.
Catfish strips were amazing. Melted in your mouth and had a great flavor.
Great food and I loved the atmosphere.
Will come again.

data.title: Great BBQ
data.text:
Great BBQ... being from Texas that's high praise. The brisket was amazing and the rest of the family had pulled pork which was also great... very tender and flavorful.
If you're looking for a break from the seaside seafood, then you should try TBG

data.title: Would return if ever in the area
data.text:
Pretty unusual place....here we are in California and there is New Orleans Saints reminders throughout.....even has Abita beer on the menu !!!!  If you wear Saints clothing, you get a discount on your food!!!  And, police and firemen also receive a discount.

The important part of this review::::  The food is good.....we shared the brisket sandwich with smoked baked beans and cornbread.....$10.59 with tax.  Filled us up and we enjoyed every bite.

Highly recommend this restaurant when you are in the area.

Story is that the owner is from Louisiana.....that make sense !!!

data.title: Scrumptious
data.text: Tried this restaurant while vacationing. Family friendly & inexpensive. Our food was delicious, and service was excellent.

data.title: Best BBQ in town
data.text: This place is amazing if you are in the mood for BBQ you have to stop by.  Everyone is super friendly.

data.title: Fun Local Restaurant
data.text: We had the dirty fries, mac and cheese, and chicken sandwich, which were all very good. Server and host were both nice and friendly. There was no wait for a table. It was a little hot inside, but not awful.

data.title: BBQ and beer
data.text: Came by for a light dinner.  Ordered a sandwich to split and some dirty fries - could not eat it all - the servings are really large.  Happy hour deal on Rolling Rock beer was great, but the price of pitchers seem really high.

data.title: great food great atmosphere
data.text: We tried this BBQ upon a tip from a police officer.  We were glad we tried it!  It is a casual, open air place with excellent food and great service.  We got the fries appetizer with bbq and cheese in it ( can't remember name of dish) and it was awesome!  I prefer ribs usually but went with the pork bbq platter and it was excellent and too much food for 1 person. Portions were generous!  The 4 of us all got different meals and we were all completely satisfied.  Great choice!

data.title: Great food, so much so good
data.text:
Great BBQ taste, the kind of food you don't want to end .generous portions,
Ribs are great ,unique flavors , some foods I have never seen ,and are great!

data.title: Like good BBQ? Look no more....
data.text: Have been looking for a good barbecue place for a while. That Boy Good fit the bill. Very casual, wait was short, service was good, had BBQ sandwich Flavor was really good. Like that extra sauce was on the table, side dishes also delicious. Would like to go back soon to try other items on menu. Decorations had the look and feel of authentic BBQ joint.

data.title: BBQ
data.text: This is a family favorite. Number one birthday dinner request. Favorite dish, chicken and waffles. All the sides are delish. Super casual, down home food, good service and cozy environment.

data.title: BBQ place that's overrated
data.text:
Decent for a quick BBQ meal. Don't kid yourself it's not top shelf. 
The place does have a nice atmosphere and I really dig their music selection.

data.title: Don't need to travel to Texas for good BBQ.
data.text: The food is really good. The ribs, chicken and catfish are outstanding. The sides are delicious. I love the velvety mac & cheese and the fries are the best. I have travelled to Texas for business many times I am usually disappointed with BBQ in Southern California. I was not at this establishment. I have been there many times and will continue to do so. The service is also always very good.

data.title: Boy that's good!
data.text: Had high expectation given the reviews and it didn't disappoint.  I knew it might be good when a line started to form 15 minutes before the place opened (that doesn't really happen in San Diego).  The fried chicken and waffles were amazing and are making me hungry for them just writing this review.

data.title: great food @ decent price
data.text: Low key secrete spot for great food and beer.  Some good BBQ and specialized cheese fries with pulled pork, must try!!
